verses.roman:
dui-dike mātā-pitā puṣṭa kalevara
madhye eka 'śiśu' haya tribhaṅga-sundara

synonyms: dui-dike—on two sides; mātā-pitā—father and mother; puṣṭa kalevara—very well-built body; madhye—between them; eka—one; śiśu—child; haya—there is; tri-bhaṅga—curved in three places; sundara—very beautiful.
translation: "There is a father and mother with well-built bodies, and between them is a very beautiful child who is curved in three places."
